original_definition: 'model identifier' means a code, usually alphanumeric, which distinguishes a specific equipment model from other models with the same trade mark or the same manufacturer’s, importer’s or authorised representative’s name;
generated_definition: 'model identifier' means a unique identifier assigned to an equipment model by the manufacturer, importer or authorized representative for the purpose of compliance with european union legislation.

Article\u00a02: ‘equivalent model’ means anequipmentmodel which has the same technical characteristics relevant for the technical information to be provided in accordance with Annex II, but which is placed on the market or put into service by the same manufacturer, importer or authorised representative as another equipment model with a differentmodel identifier;

‘model identifier’ means a code, usually alphanumeric, which distinguishes a specificequipment model from other models with the same trade mark or the same manufacturer’s, importer’s or authorised representative’s name;

‘equivalent model’ means an equipment model which has the same technical characteristics relevant for the technical information to be provided in accordance with Annex II, but which is placed on the market or put into service by the same manufacturer, importer or authorised representative as another equipment model with a different model identifier;

‘model identifier’ means a code, usually alphanumeric, which distinguishes a specific equipment model from other models with the same trade mark or the same manufacturer’s, importer’s or authorised representative’s name;
Article\u00a04: The technical documentation shall include a list of equivalent models referred to in the first and second subparagraph, including the model identifiers.
The technical documentation shall include a list ofequivalent models referred to in the first and second subparagraph, including themodel identifiers.
